title: Taiwan’s Tsai Convinces House Speaker McCarthy to Meet in US, FT Reports
description: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen persuaded House Speaker Kevin McCarthy to meet in the US due to security worries, the Financial Times said, a move that appeared aimed at avoiding another crisis with China.

title: Trudeau Orders Review of Alleged Chinese Election Interference
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau yielded to pressure over allegations China interfered in Canada’s elections, appointing a special investigator to study the matter.

title: Australia’s Albanese Says Natural Gas Investment Shouldn’t Be Curbed
description: Australia’s natural gas industry should be permitted to follow the most promising returns on capital, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said in his first defense of the industry since his government proposed tightening export rules.

title: TikTok Ban Inches Ahead as Bipartisan Senate Duo to Unveil Bill
description: Senate Intelligence Committee Chairman Mark Warner is set to unveil a bill Tuesday that would allow the US to ban the popular video-sharing app TikTok and other Chinese technology, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Labour Party Proposes UK Business Tax Review to Boost Investment
description: The UK’s main opposition Labour Party said it would review the country’s business tax regime to boost investment, insisting that the Conservative government’s approach is hampering growth.

title: Hong Kong Is Shutting the Last of Its Covid Quarantine Camps. Now What?
description: In a city where the unaffordability of housing is among the most urgent issues, some are pressing the government to utilize the pandemic relics to alleviate the problem.

title: What Seating Says About Power Around Xi at China’s NPC Meeting
description: Where you sit can often tell your status in the office hierarchy. It’s no different at the National People’s Congress, where Xi Jinping’s allies are all crammed around the Chinese leader.

title: Biden Press Secretary Laughs Off Author’s 2024 Challenge
description: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre offered a dismissive response to Democrat Marianne Williamson’s long-shot 2024 presidential campaign, poking fun at the self-help author and spiritual adviser.

title: FTC Expected to Challenge ICE's $13.1 Billion Black Knight Deal This Week
description: The Federal Trade Commission is expected to sue Intercontinental Exchange Inc. over its proposed $13.1 billion acquisition of mortgage software rival Black Knight Inc. as soon as Thursday, according to two people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Jim Jordan Issues Subpoenas to Investigate ‘Weaponization’ of Federal Agencies
description: House Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan has subpoenaed the former head of a defunct Biden administration advisory board on disinformation, which was disbanded just months after being formed amid public backlash.

title: Brazil Hurries Fiscal Plan to Push for Lower Borrowing Costs
description: Brazil’s economic team intends to unveil a plan to shore up the country’s fiscal credibility before the central bank’s upcoming interest rate decision in a bid to pressure the monetary authority into lowering borrowing costs, according to two people with knowledge of the matter.

title: NYC Wants Shoppers to Take Off Masks in Crime-Fighting Measure
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams called on shop owners to require customers to remove their face masks when entering stores to help cut down on retail crime that has surged since the pandemic.

title: Lawyers for Big Business Are Busiest in Years Fighting Biden’s Rules
description: The lawyers working for the US Chamber of Commerce are the busiest they have been in years as President Joe Biden’s administration rolls out new regulations, the group’s chief executive officer said.

title: Ramaphosa Revamps Cabinet as South Africa Battles Power Crisis
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa appointed a new deputy and electricity czar and replaced several ministers, injecting new blood into a cabinet that has failed to come to grips with crippling energy shortages and revive a flagging economy.

title: Senate Vote to Put Lawmakers on Record on DC Crime, Reduced Sentences
description: Senate Democrats will be forced to take a stand on a GOP-drafted measure to nullify a District of Columbia law reducing the penalties for some violent crimes despite a last-minute attempt by the city council to take back the legislation.

title: Texas’ Record $3.5 Billion Muni Deal to Sell After Two-Year Saga
description: A Texas agency is poised to issue the largest-ever municipal-bond deal in the Lone Star State, a historic $3.5 billion transaction designed to bail out natural gas utilities that incurred billions of dollars of unexpected costs during a deadly winter storm two years ago.

title: Biden Hints at 2024 Run in Speech to Firefighters’ Union
description: President Joe Biden sought to shore up support from an important labor union whose members enjoy broad appeal across the political spectrum ahead of an expected 2024 reelection bid.

title: American Dream Mall Owes NJ Town $8 Million, Lawsuit Says
description: A New Jersey town sued the American Dream mall and entertainment complex over its refusal to make about $7.5 million in property tax-like payments and $400,000 for sewer service.

title: Quiet Politician Steps Up to Challenge Erdogan in Turkish Election
description: Turkish politicians picked the head of the main opposition party to challenge President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in elections in two months’ time, hoping a familiar face can reverse a shaky campaign to unseat the country’s longest-serving leader.

title: JetBlue-Spirit Deal Faces DOJ Antitrust Suit as Soon as Tuesday
description: The Justice Department and Department of Transportation are expected to take action as soon as Tuesday to block JetBlue Airways Corp.’s $3.8 billion merger with Spirit Airlines Inc., according to people familiar with the case.

title: N. Ireland’s DUP Sets Up Group to Assess New UK-EU Brexit Plan
description: Northern Ireland’s Democratic Unionist Party is setting up a consultation group to consider the UK and European Union’s new post-Brexit agreement.

title: Biden Steps Up Scrutiny of Lack of Competition in US Seed Industry
description: Seed companies, which farmers complain use their market power to keep prices high, have been put on notice by the White House.

title: JPMorgan Says Bright Mexico Outlook Contrasts With Brazil Gloom
description: Mexican economy to benefit from high external demand while Brazil faces recession, JPMorgan economists write

title: Only Meat Raised in US Can Get Product-of-USA Label Under New Rule
description: The Biden administration is moving to stop the food industry from promoting meat from foreign animals as products of the US, closing a labeling loophole that has infuriated domestic ranchers and consumer advocates for years.

title: DUP Leader Sets Up Panel to Inform Deliberations on Windsor Framework Deal
description: The DUP has established a consultation panel to inform its deliberations on the new deal on post-Brexit trading arrangements for Northern Ireland.

title: South Africa Rand’s Volatility Rises Amid Ramaphosa Farm Robbery Scandal
description: The rand’s volatility is soaring as a scandal involving South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and the sale of buffalo once again shakes investor confidence.

title: Estonia Calls for EU to Halve the $60 Price Cap on Russian Oil
description: The European Union should halve the $60 price cap on Russian oil this month and further squeeze Moscow’s ability to fund the war in Ukraine, Estonia’s foreign minister said.

title: US Will Ask Mexico for Formal Talks, Escalating Fight Over GMO Corn
description: The Biden administration plans to escalate its conflict with Mexico over genetically modified US corn with a request for formal consultations under their free-trade agreement, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Belarus Court Sentences Exiled Opposition Leader to 15 Years
description: A court in Belarus sentenced exiled opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya to 15 years in a penal colony as the nation’s authorities continue to crack down on opposition at home and abroad.

title: Russia’s Budget Deficit Hits $34 Billion But Spending Growth Slows
description: Russia’s budget deficit jumped in the first two months of the year but spending showed signs of growing at a slower pace amid the invasion of Ukraine.

title: More UK Doctors Threaten Strike Even As Nurses Call Off Protests
description: Senior doctors in the UK’s beleaguered National Health Service are threatening action over pay and pensions even as nurses and ambulance drivers called off their strike and entered into talks.

title: Russia's Crude Exports Slide as Lucrative Pacific Trade Declines
description: Total seaborne shipments fell by more than 500,000 barrels a day, with all the drop coming at Pacific ports

title: Trump’s Threat of a Third-Party Run Is Undercut by ‘Sore Loser’ Laws
description: Donald Trump hates losing so much that he has suggested he will mount a third-party campaign if he doesn’t win the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Belarus Sentences Exiled Opposition Leader to 15 Years in Prison
description: TALLINN, Estonia (AP) — A court in Belarus on Monday sentenced exiled opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya to 15 years in prison after a trial in absentia on charges including conspiring to overthrow the government, the latest move in a months-long effort by the Belarusian government to suppress dissent.

title: Iran Supreme Leader Calls Wave of School Poisonings ‘Big Crime’
description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei urged officials to “seriously pursue” cases of suspected poisonings at girls’ schools around the country, which left hundreds of students hospitalized and sparked nationwide anger.

title: French Unions Say Pension Protests Will Bring Country to a Halt
description: French unions say they’ll bring the country to a halt on Tuesday with large-scale strikes and marches against President Emmanuel Macron’s plan to raise the retirement age.

title: Xi Rallies China to Overcome ‘Containment’ in Direct Shot at US
description: Xi Jinping, China's president, during the unveiling of the Communist Party of China's new Politburo Standing Committee at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing, China, on Sunday, Oct. 23, 2022. President Xi Jinping stacked China's most powerful body with his allies, giving him unfettered control over the world's second-largest economy. Bloomberg

title: Israel President Says Pact on Judicial Overhaul Closer Than Ever
description: Israel’s President Isaac Herzog said a compromise is within reach in the dispute over the government’s controversial judicial overhaul plan after what he described as behind-the-scenes agreements on most of the issues.

title: Estonian Premier to Forge New Coalition After Election Win
description: Estonia’s premier, one of NATO’s most vocal supporters of Ukraine, vowed to forge a new coalition government after securing a solid election victory over a far-right party, putting her in a strong position to extend her tenure.

title: African Union Cancels Tunisia Meeting After Censure Over Racism
description: The African Union canceled a conference it planned to hold in Tunisia later this month, after criticizing the government over attacks on migrants in the country.

title: Turkish Opposition Is Back From the Brink After Leadership Spat
description: Turkey’s frazzled political opposition is set to reunite after key leaders resolved a spat over who should be their joint candidate to compete against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in May elections.

title: Nigeria’s Ruling Party Wins Most Seats in Parliamentary Election
description: Nigeria’s ruling party won the most seats in both of the country’s legislative chambers in last month’s elections, bolstering president-elect Bola Tinubu’s ability to implement his policy agenda.

title: Emerging Market Woes Fuel Great Power Contest
description: Some big emerging markets are flashing warning signs, fed by heightened political risk and a strong undercurrent of economic turmoil.

title: Starmer Brands Johnson ‘Desperate’ Over Sue Gray Complaints
description: UK opposition leader Keir Starmer rejected suggestions that a decision to offer a job to a senior government official had undermined an inquiry into whether former Prime Minister Boris Johnson broke lockdown rules.

title: Saudi Arabia Finalizes $5 Billion for Turkey to Bolster Economy
description: Saudi Arabia finalized an agreement to deposit $5 billion at the Turkish central bank, moving forward with a pledge made last year that is expected to provide a major boost for President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: South African Tax Body Unable to Trace Cash Paid to Ramaphosa
description: South Africa’s tax authority said it’s unable to find records of funds brought into the country by a Sudanese businessman that were used to purchase buffalo from President Cyril Ramaphosa.

title: China Will Create a New Agency to Regulate Data, WSJ Says
description: China plans to create a central agency to manage the flow of data within the country and abroad, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: UK PM Sunak Rejects Calls to Cancel Increase in Business Tax
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak rejected calls from his own ruling Conservative Party to cancel a rise in UK corporation tax due to come into force next month, according to a person familiar with government plans.

title: South Africa Trade Minister Named Lawmaker Before Cabinet Revamp
description: South Africa’s trade minister has been appointed as a lawmaker, giving President Cyril Ramaphosa more flexibility when it comes to revamping his executive.

title: Ex-PM Imran Khan Attempts to Block Pakistan Arrest Warrant
description: Pakistan’s former Prime Minister Imran Khan is looking to suspend an arrest warrant against him after police officials attempted to arrest the opposition leader a day earlier.

title: Five Dead After Azerbaijan, Armenia Clash in Disputed Region
description: At least five people were killed in fighting between Azerbaijani troops and ethnic Armenian law enforcement in the breakaway region of Nagorno-Karabakh, the area’s deadliest skirmish in more than six months.

title: Suicide Bombing in Pakistan Kills 9 Police Officers
description: QUETTA, Pakistan (AP) — A suicide bomber riding on a motorcycle rammed into a police truck in Pakistan's restive southwest, killing at least nine policemen and wounding 13 officers, authorities said.

title: Pakistan Suicide Bombing Kills 9 Troops in Southwest Region
description: A suicide bomber attacked Pakistan’s paramilitary forces killing 9 troops in Southwest Balochistan province in escalation of violence in the past year.

title: Ukraine Latest: Russia Continues Attempt to Cut Off Bakhmut
description: Ukraine’s armed forces said Russian troops continue to pursue an attempt to cut off the besieged eastern city of Bakhmut. Kremlin forces are on the offensive along five axes in Ukraine’s east, including near Bakhmut.

title: China to Meet or Likely Exceed GDP Target, Ex-PBOC Official Says
description: Chances are high China’s government will meet or exceed its relatively modest economic growth target for this year, a former central bank official said, with a more stable property market helping to underpin the recovery.

title: Xi Vows to Boost High-End Manufacturing in Face of US Pressure
description: China will take forceful measures to support the development of high-end manufacturing, President Xi Jinping said in first comments at the closely watched National People’s Congress.

title: Here Are the Stranger Ideas Being Talked About at China’s Elite Gathering
description: Thousands of delegates have descended on China’s most important political gathering this week to vie for Beijing’s ear on a slew of unusual proposals, ranging from reinventing the weekend to offering free education as an incentive for parents to have more children.

title: Drivers Protest Philippine Plan Fearing End of Iconic Jeepneys
description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Philippine transport groups launched a nationwide strike Monday to protest a government program drivers fear would phase out traditional jeepneys, which have become a cultural icon, and other aging public transport vehicles.

title: Singapore Top Diplomat Says ‘Peace Dividend’ After WWII Is Over
description: Singapore’s Foreign Affairs Minister Vivian Balakrishnan said growing defense spending, including by China and across Asia, is evidence a peace dividend after World War II that fueled global economic growth is largely over.

title: US Lawmakers Step Up Push to Ban TikTok With Bill This Week
description: US Senate Intelligence Committee Chairman Mark Warner plans to introduce a bill this week to allow the US to systematically ban Chinese technology, including services like TikTok, he told Fox News on Sunday.

title: UK Less Attractive Than US, EU for Investment, Shell Chief Says
description: Shell Plc’s new boss said Britain is less attractive as an investment destination than both the US and Europe because it is failing to match green energy subsidies, according to an interview with The Times of London.

title: South Korea Releases Plan to Ease Forced-Labor Spat With Japan
description: South Korea announced a plan to ease its dispute with Japan over colonial-era forced labor, removing a stumbling block to US President Joe Biden’s bid to expand cooperation between two key Asian allies.

title: UK Unveils £360 Million Science Plan in Pre-Budget Growth Push
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is committing more than £360 million to cutting-edge technologies under plans to make Britain a science “superpower” by the end of the decade, as he starts to sketch out his vision in the build-up to next week’s budget.
